page.title: 14EDUCATION
page.content: In the 1870's children attended school irregularly as they had to work in the fields. Sometimes they were sent home for uncleanliness Her Majesty's Inspectorate visited rgularly. An outbreak of scarlatina caused the school to close in October 1875. Discipline was a problem in 1875. The Headteacher wrote:- "The children were more orderly this afternoon and the boys gave greater attention to their lessons, but still there is much difficulty in marking the attendance registers as the children do not know their places. Gave the order that if anyone left the place in which they where seated they should stay behind half an hour. Great self-possesion and firmness is necessary with these children."
